title.narrative: EQUITY-FOCUS POLICIES, STRATEGIES & PLAN

description.narrative: Output 1: By 2018, evidence based equity focus policies, strategies and plans developed and implemented by the education sector at national, county and community level focusing on Nomadic, Peace Education/DRR, CFS and children with special needs, girls and children affected by conflict within NESSP framework, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Sanitation, Skills Development, Unicef Capacity For Programming On Gender, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Salaries and Related Costs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1: By 2018, evidence based equity focus policies, strategies and plans developed and implemented by the education sector atnational, county and community level focusing on Nomadic, Peace Education/DRR, CFS and children with special needs, girls andchildren affected by conflict within NESSP framework

description.narrative: The policy for Learners and Trainees with Disabilities was launched to improve access to equitable and inclusive quality education. Technical support to MoE led to finalization of the Education Sector Plan 2018-2022 strategy and policy document. The refugee education policy and, mentorship policy was finalized and await launch | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:30/06/2018

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance

Service Delivery - Communities - School management committees (or parent teacher association or school communities or similar structure) whose capacity was developed through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
Education system are implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote learning outcomes including early learning
